p: We selected Barro Preto municipality because of its location in the centre of the historical cocoa producing region and because of its proximity to the MCCS. The municipality has a forest cover of approximately 80% [ 38, 39]. Cocoa farms cover 9,100 ha, more than half of the total area of the municipality (16,000 ha). Traditional cocoa agroforests, called cabrucas, have tree species both native from the Atlantic Forest ecosystem and introduced of economic interest (i.e. fruits, timber and rubber) with cocoa as the main cash crop.
